[22:22:47]: Removing "a" Tags From "The badger enters a state of pure rage that lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=38" style="text-decoration:underline">unconscious</a>, whichever comes first. It can’t voluntarily stop raging. While raging, the badger is affected in the following ways. <ul><li>It deals 4 additional damage with its bite attacks and 2 additional damage with its claw attacks.</li> <li>It takes a –1 penalty to AC.</li> <li>It can’t use actions that have the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32" style="text-decoration:underline">concentrate</a> trait unless they also have the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=135" style="text-decoration:underline">rage</a> trait. The animal companion can <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=84" style="text-decoration:underline">Seek</a> even while raging.</li></ul> After it has stopped raging, it can’t use Badger Rage again for 1 minute.".
[22:22:47]: Start: 126.
[22:22:47]: Removing "a" Tags From "The badger enters a state of pure rage that lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls unconscious, whichever comes first. It can’t voluntarily stop raging. While raging, the badger is affected in the following ways. <ul><li>It deals 4 additional damage with its bite attacks and 2 additional damage with its claw attacks.</li> <li>It takes a –1 penalty to AC.</li> <li>It can’t use actions that have the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32" style="text-decoration:underline">concentrate</a> trait unless they also have the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=135" style="text-decoration:underline">rage</a> trait. The animal companion can <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=84" style="text-decoration:underline">Seek</a> even while raging.</li></ul> After it has stopped raging, it can’t use Badger Rage again for 1 minute.".
[22:22:47]: Start: 444.
[22:22:47]: Removing "a" Tags From "The badger enters a state of pure rage that lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls unconscious, whichever comes first. It can’t voluntarily stop raging. While raging, the badger is affected in the following ways. <ul><li>It deals 4 additional damage with its bite attacks and 2 additional damage with its claw attacks.</li> <li>It takes a –1 penalty to AC.</li> <li>It can’t use actions that have the concentrate trait unless they also have the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=135" style="text-decoration:underline">rage</a> trait. The animal companion can <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=84" style="text-decoration:underline">Seek</a> even while raging.</li></ul> After it has stopped raging, it can’t use Badger Rage again for 1 minute.".
[22:22:47]: Start: 488.
[22:22:47]: Removing "a" Tags From "The badger enters a state of pure rage that lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls unconscious, whichever comes first. It can’t voluntarily stop raging. While raging, the badger is affected in the following ways. <ul><li>It deals 4 additional damage with its bite attacks and 2 additional damage with its claw attacks.</li> <li>It takes a –1 penalty to AC.</li> <li>It can’t use actions that have the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. The animal companion can <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=84" style="text-decoration:underline">Seek</a> even while raging.</li></ul> After it has stopped raging, it can’t use Badger Rage again for 1 minute.".
[22:22:47]: Start: 525.
[22:22:47]: Found The badger enters a state of pure rage that lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls unconscious, whichever comes first. It can’t voluntarily stop raging. While raging, the badger is affected in the following ways. <ul><li>It deals 4 additional damage with its bite attacks and 2 additional damage with its claw attacks.</li> <li>It takes a –1 penalty to AC.</li> <li>It can’t use actions that have the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. The animal companion can Seek even while raging.</li></ul> After it has stopped raging, it can’t use Badger Rage again for 1 minute.
[22:22:47]: ['Badger', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=1', 'Your companion is a badger, wolverine, or other big mustelid.', 'Small', [['jaws,', 'Melee', '1d8', 'piercing'], ['claw (agile),', 'Melee', '1d6', 'slashing']], '+2,  +2,  +2,  -4,  +2,  +0', '8', ['Survival'], 'low-light vision,  scent (imprecise 30 feet),', '25 feet, burrow 10 feet, climb 10 feet', 'Your badger digs around your foe’s position, interfering with its footing. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit and deal damage to a creature your badger threatens, the target can’t use a Step action (unless it can Step through difficult terrain) until it moves from its current position.', 'Badger Rage', 'The badger enters a state of pure rage that lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls unconscious, whichever comes first. It can’t voluntarily stop raging. While raging, the badger is affected in the following ways. <ul><li>It deals 4 additional damage with its bite attacks and 2 additional damage with its claw attacks.</li> <li>It takes a –1 penalty to AC.</li> <li>It can’t use actions that have the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. The animal companion can Seek even while raging.</li></ul> After it has stopped raging, it can’t use Badger Rage again for 1 minute.'].

[22:22:47]: Removing "a" Tags From " Your crocodile clamps its jaws on your foe, refusing to let go. Until the start of your next turn, if your Strike damages a creature in your crocodile's reach, your crocodile can latch onto the creature. While thus attached, the crocodile can move along with the target whenever the target moves until the end of your next turn. Your crocodile can latch onto only one creature in this way, and it must release the creature to make a jaws Strike. If the target is smaller than the crocodile, it takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds and can't <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=94" style="text-decoration:underline">Fly</a> while the crocodile is latched on.".
[22:22:47]: Start: 557.
[22:22:47]: Found Your crocodile clamps its jaws on your foe, refusing to let go. Until the start of your next turn, if your Strike damages a creature in your crocodile's reach, your crocodile can latch onto the creature. While thus attached, the crocodile can move along with the target whenever the target moves until the end of your next turn. Your crocodile can latch onto only one creature in this way, and it must release the creature to make a jaws Strike. If the target is smaller than the crocodile, it takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds and can't Fly while the crocodile is latched on.

[22:22:47]: Removing "a" Tags From "The pangolin coils into a ball to defend itself. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC. Any creature that hits the pangolin with a melee unarmed attack while it's in its Defensive Curl take 2d6 <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=29" style="text-decoration:underline">persistent bleed</a> damage. The pangolin can't move, use its unarmed attacks, or take other actions that require it to use its limbs while in its Defensive Curl, but it can unfurl as a single action, ending the effects of Defensive Curl.".
[22:22:47]: Start: 195.
[22:22:47]: Found The pangolin coils into a ball to defend itself. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC. Any creature that hits the pangolin with a melee unarmed attack while it's in its Defensive Curl take 2d6 persistent bleed damage. The pangolin can't move, use its unarmed attacks, or take other actions that require it to use its limbs while in its Defensive Curl, but it can unfurl as a single action, ending the effects of Defensive Curl.

Any creature that hits the pangolin with a melee unarmed attack while it's in its Defensive Curl take 2d6 persistent bleed damage. The pangolin can't move, use its unarmed attacks, or take other actions that require it to use its limbs while in its Defensive Curl, but it can unfurl as a single action, ending the effects of Defensive Curl."].

[22:22:47]: Removing "a" Tags From "The Ulgrem-Lurann bites down hard and unleashes an electrical discharge. It makes a jaws Strike. As it's so young, its intelligence hasn't developed yet, but some day, it will become a highly intelligent creature. An Ulgrem-Lurann has the beast trait instead of the animal trait but otherwise functions normally as an animal companion.", "Medium", "jaws;tail", "Melee;Melee", "1d8;1d6", "piercing;bludgeoning", "+3","+2","+2", "-4","+0","+1", 6, "Intimidation", "darkvision,", "20 feet, swim 25 feet", "The Ulgrem-Lurann grabs at your foe and zaps it. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in the Ulgrem-Lurann's reach with a Strike, the creature takes an additional 1d4 piercing damage and 1d4 electricity damage from the Ulgrem-Lurann. If the Ulgrem-Lurann is nimble or savage, the piercing damage and electricity damage each increase to 2d4.", "Snatch and Zap", "The Ulgrem-Lurann bites down hard and unleashes an electrical discharge. It makes a jaws Strike. If the Strike hits, the target creature automatically becomes grabbed by the Ulgrem-Lurann and takes 1d4 electricity damage (2d4 for a mature Ulgrem-Lurann or 3d4 for a specialized companion). The grabbed condition lasts until the end of your next turn, though the Ulgrem-Lurann can use Grapple to attempt to extend the duration as normal." to Organized Output.

[22:22:53]: Found: Genie-Touched, https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=4&Advanced=true.
[22:22:53]: Getting Full Description.
[22:22:53]: Removing "a" Tags From "Xerbystes II has had his palace spellcasters work to develop ways to replicate the great powers of the genie-touched horses of Qadira. These spellcasters have a rudimentary method in place that can grant such power to any animal companion, infusing them with elemental power and granting them otherworldly insight. Xerbystes will sometimes gift these companions as a favor to others or have his spellcasters infuse the companions of trusted allies. If you take a feat that would normally allow you to choose to have a savage or nimble animal companion, you can instead choose to for it to become a genie-touched companion. When you choose the feat, select the type of genie whose power infuses your companion. The genies and their elemental traits are as follows: <a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=212" style="text-decoration:underline">djinni</a> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=5" style="text-decoration:underline">air</a>), <a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=214" style="text-decoration:underline">efreeti</a> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=72" style="text-decoration:underline">fire</a>), <a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=215" style="text-decoration:underline">marid</a> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=165" style="text-decoration:underline">water</a>), or <a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=213" style="text-decoration:underline">shaitan</a> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=55" style="text-decoration:underline">earth</a>). A genie-touched companion increases its Wisdom modifier by 2 and its Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its unarmed attacks; this damage is fire damage for an efreet-touched companion or of the same type as the unarmed attack for the others. It gains resistance 5 to damage of a type depending on the genie: acid for djinni, fire for efreeti or marid, and electricity for shaitan. If the companion is djinni-touched or efreeti-touched, increase its proficiency rank in <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1" style="text-decoration:underline">Acrobatics</a> to expert; if it is marid-touched or shaitan-touched, increase its proficiency rank in <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3" style="text-decoration:underline">Athletics</a> to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. Its attacks count as magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances and gain the genie's elemental trait.
".

A genie-touched companion increases its Wisdom modifier by 2 and its Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its unarmed attacks; this damage is fire damage for an efreet-touched companion or of the same type as the unarmed attack for the others. It gains resistance 5 to damage of a type depending on the genie: acid for djinni, fire for efreeti or marid, and electricity for shaitan. If the companion is djinni-touched or efreeti-touched, increase its proficiency rank in Acrobatics to expert; if it is marid-touched or shaitan-touched, increase its proficiency rank in Athletics to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. Its attacks count as magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances and gain the genie's elemental trait.".
[22:22:53]: Could Not Find Start Position. Checking for End Position.
[22:22:53]: Found No End Position.
[22:22:53]: Returning.
[22:22:53]: Removing "h3" Tags From "Xerbystes II has had his palace spellcasters work to develop ways to replicate the great powers of the genie-touched horses of Qadira. These spellcasters have a rudimentary method in place that can grant such power to any animal companion, infusing them with elemental power and granting them otherworldly insight. Xerbystes will sometimes gift these companions as a favor to others or have his spellcasters infuse the companions of trusted allies. If you take a feat that would normally allow you to choose to have a savage or nimble animal companion, you can instead choose to for it to become a genie-touched companion. When you choose the feat, select the type of genie whose power infuses your companion. The genies and their elemental traits are as follows: djinni (air), efreeti (fire), marid (water), or shaitan (earth). A genie-touched companion increases its Wisdom modifier by 2 and its Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its unarmed attacks; this damage is fire damage for an efreet-touched companion or of the same type as the unarmed attack for the others. It gains resistance 5 to damage of a type depending on the genie: acid for djinni, fire for efreeti or marid, and electricity for shaitan. If the companion is djinni-touched or efreeti-touched, increase its proficiency rank in Acrobatics to expert; if it is marid-touched or shaitan-touched, increase its proficiency rank in Athletics to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. Its attacks count as magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances and gain the genie's elemental trait.".

[22:22:53]: Found: Indomitable, https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=3&Advanced=true.
[22:22:53]: Getting Full Description.
[22:22:53]: Removing "a" Tags From "When you pick your animal companion, you can choose to have it be a megafauna animal companion. Megafauna animal companions are mostly similar to other animal companions of the same category, though they look different, and they have one difference in their upgrade path. If you take a feat that would normally allow you to choose to have your companion become a savage or nimble animal companion, a megafauna companion instead can choose to become a savage or indomitable companion. An indomitable companion increases its Constitution modifier by 2 and its Strength, Dexterity, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency rank in Athletics to expert and its proficiency rank in barding to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. If your companion is Medium or smaller, it grows in size by one category. Its attacks count as magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.".
[22:22:53]: Could Not Find Start Position. Checking for End Position.
[22:22:53]: Found No End Position.
[22:22:53]: Returning.
[22:22:53]: Removing "h1" Tags From "When you pick your animal companion, you can choose to have it be a megafauna animal companion. Megafauna animal companions are mostly similar to other animal companions of the same category, though they look different, and they have one difference in their upgrade path. If you take a feat that would normally allow you to choose to have your companion become a savage or nimble animal companion, a megafauna companion instead can choose to become a savage or indomitable companion. An indomitable companion increases its Constitution modifier by 2 and its Strength, Dexterity, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency rank in Athletics to expert and its proficiency rank in barding to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. If your companion is Medium or smaller, it grows in size by one category. Its attacks count as magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.".

[22:22:53]: Found No End Position.
[22:22:53]: Returning.
[22:22:53]: Removing "b" Tags From "When you pick your animal companion, you can choose to have it be a megafauna animal companion. Megafauna animal companions are mostly similar to other animal companions of the same category, though they look different, and they have one difference in their upgrade path. If you take a feat that would normally allow you to choose to have your companion become a savage or nimble animal companion, a megafauna companion instead can choose to become a savage or indomitable companion. An indomitable companion increases its Constitution modifier by 2 and its Strength, Dexterity, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency rank in Athletics to expert and its proficiency rank in barding to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. If your companion is Medium or smaller, it grows in size by one category. Its attacks count as magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.".
[22:22:53]: Could Not Find Start Position. Checking for End Position.
[22:22:53]: Found No End Position.

[22:22:53]: Found: When you pick your animal companion, you can choose to have it be a megafauna animal companion. Megafauna animal companions are mostly similar to other animal companions of the same category, though they look different, and they have one difference in their upgrade path. If you take a feat that would normally allow you to choose to have your companion become a savage or nimble animal companion, a megafauna companion instead can choose to become a savage or indomitable companion. An indomitable companion increases its Constitution modifier by 2 and its Strength, Dexterity, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency rank in Athletics to expert and its proficiency rank in barding to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. If your companion is Medium or smaller, it grows in size by one category. Its attacks count as magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.

".

[22:22:54]: Getting Full Description.
[22:22:54]: Removing "a" Tags From "Cryptid animal companions look a touch peculiar, often with uncanny features or ones that seem to come from a different animal. If you take a feat that would normally allow you to choose to have your companion become a savage or nimble animal companion, you can choose to make it an unseen animal companion instead. An unseen companion increases its Wisdom modifier by 2 and its Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=199" style="text-decoration:underline">unarmed</a> attacks and deals an extra 1d4 precision damage against <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=16" style="text-decoration:underline">flat-footed</a> targets (if the animal companion already deals precision damage, such as a cat, combine the precision damage). Increase its proficiency rank in <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15" style="text-decoration:underline">Stealth</a> to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type.
</span".

[22:23:00]: Found: Access ShadowcasterYour companion's physical form is made, in whole or in part, of shadow. [22:23:00]: Removing "a" Tags From "Your companion ignores natural difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from sediment or stone and can move across quicksand, mud, and similar surfaces as if they were solid. [22:23:00]: Getting Full Description.
[22:23:00]: Removing "a" Tags From "Your companion gains resistance to fire equal to your level. Any creature that attempts to <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=35" style="text-decoration:underline">Grapple</a> or <a href="MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18" style="text-decoration:underline">Grab</a> your companion, hits your companion with a melee unarmed attack, or hits your companion with a melee weapon Strike while adjacent to your companion takes 2d6 fire damage. Its Dexterity modifier increases by 1 and its proficiency rank increases to legendary for Reflex saves and to expert for unarmored defense. This specialization can only be selected by <a href="AnimalCompanions.aspx?Advanced=true&amp;ID=4" style="text-decoration:underline">efreeti-touched companions</a>.
".

[22:23:02]: Inserting "Arboreal Sapling", "https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=17", "Your companion is a walking tree, a cousin of the great arboreal wardens and regents. As it's so young, its intelligence hasn't developed yet, but some day, it will become a highly intelligent creature. An Ulgrem-Lurann has the beast trait instead of the animal trait but otherwise functions normally as an animal companion.", "Medium", "jaws;tail", "Melee;Melee", "1d8;1d6", "piercing;bludgeoning", "+3","+2","+2", "-4","+0","+1", 6, "Intimidation", "darkvision", "20 feet, swim 25 feet", "The Ulgrem-Lurann grabs at your foe and zaps it. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in the Ulgrem-Lurann's reach with a Strike, the creature takes an additional 1d4 piercing damage and 1d4 electricity damage from the Ulgrem-Lurann. If the Ulgrem-Lurann is nimble or savage, the piercing damage and electricity damage each increase to 2d4.", "Snatch and Zap", "The Ulgrem-Lurann bites down hard and unleashes an electrical discharge. It makes a jaws Strike. If the Strike hits, the target creature automatically becomes grabbed by the Ulgrem-Lurann and takes 1d4 electricity damage (2d4 for a mature Ulgrem-Lurann or 3d4 for a specialized companion). The grabbed condition lasts until the end of your next turn, though the Ulgrem-Lurann can use Grapple to attempt to extend the duration as normal." Into Database.

[22:23:16]: Added "Ghost", "https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=38&Undead=true", "Your companion is a ghost, bound to an item in your possession. Due to this bond, your ghost companion can move beyond the area of a single dwelling, but it's easier to disrupt than most incorporeal creatures. A ghost companion can be formed from a humanoid, animal, or other creature. The ghost isn't sapient and is unable to speak with the living.", "Small or Medium", "ghostly touch (finesse, magical)", "Melee", "1d8", "negative", "-5","+3","+0", "-4","+1","+2", 4, "Stealth", "darkvision,", "fly 20 feet", "Your ghost spooks and scares your foes as you attack them. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit and deal damage to a creature in your ghost's reach, the creature becomes frightened 1.", "Telekinetic Assault", "Your ghost unleashes a flurry of emotions, causing small objects and debris to fly about in a 20-foot emanation, dealing 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 2 levels the ghost has (basic Reflex save). This uses a trained DC using the ghost's Charisma modifier or an expert DC if the ghost is specialized." to Organized Output.
[22:23:16]: Adding ['Skeletal Bird of Prey', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=48&Undead=true', 'Your companion is the skeleton of a bird of prey like a falcon or an owl.', 'Small', [['jaws (finesse),', 'Melee', '1d6', 'piercing'], ['talon (agile, finesse),', 'Melee', '1d4', 'slashing']], '+2,  +3,  +1,  -5,  +0,  +0', '4', [' none (mindless)'], 'darkvision,', '10 feet, fly 50 feet', "The bird flaps around and throws your foe off balance. Until the start of your next turn, when you damage a creature in the bird's reach with a Strike, that creature becomes clumsy 1 until the end of your next turn.", 'Unnerving Screech', "Your skeletal bird of prey makes an earsplitting, unnatural screech, deafening and startling an enemy within 30 feet. The target must attempt a Fortitude save. The target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour. The frightened condition is a mental, emotion, and <i>fear</i> effect, but the creature can still be deafened if it's immune to these."] to Organized Output String.
[22:23:16]: Added "Skeletal Bird of Prey", "https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=48&Undead=true", "Your companion is the skeleton of a bird of prey like a falcon or an owl.", "Small", "jaws (finesse);talon (agile, finesse)", "Melee;Melee", "1d6;1d4", "piercing;slashing", "+2","+3","+1", "-5","+0","+0", 4, " none (mindless)", "darkvision,", "10 feet, fly 50 feet", "The bird flaps around and throws your foe off balance. Until the start of your next turn, when you damage a creature in the bird's reach with a Strike, that creature becomes clumsy 1 until the end of your next turn.", "Unnerving Screech", "Your skeletal bird of prey makes an earsplitting, unnatural screech, deafening and startling an enemy within 30 feet. The target must attempt a Fortitude save. The target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour. The frightened condition is a mental, emotion, and <i>fear</i> effect, but the creature can still be deafened if it's immune to these." to Organized Output.
[22:23:16]: Adding ['Skeletal Constrictor', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=49&Undead=true', 'Your companion is the skeleton of a constrictor snake such as a boa or python. Red lights burn deep in its eye sockets.', 'Small', [['jaws (finesse),', 'Melee', '1d8', 'piercing']], '+2,  +2,  +1,  -5,  +1,  +0', '4', [' none (mindless)'], 'darkvision,', '20 feet, climb 20 feet, swim 20 feet', 'Your snake sways, captivating an enemy. Choose one creature within 20 feet of the constrictor that can see it. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that deal damage to the chosen creature make the target flat-footed until the end of your next turn.', 'Bony Constriction', "The skeletal constrictor deals 12 piercing damage to the grabbed creature with its sharp ribs; the creature must attempt a basic Fortitude save. If the constrictor is a specialized companion, increase this damage to 20. This uses a trained DC using the constrictor's Constitution modifier, or an expert DC if the constrictor is specialized."] to Organized Output String.

If the constrictor is a specialized companion, increase this damage to 20. This is an emotion, fear, and mental effect.', 'Gallop', 'The skeletal mount Strides twice, with a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.'] to Organized Output String.

Skeletal mounts can be collapsed, gathered into piles of bone, and packed away for storage.", "Large", "hoof (agile)", "Melee", "1d6", "bludgeoning", "+2","+2","+2", "-5","+0","+0", 4, " none (mindless)", "darkvision,", "35 feet", "Your skeletal mount strikes fear when it charges. Until the start of your next turn, if you are riding your skeletal mount and move at least 10 feet on the action before your attack, any creature damaged by the attack becomes frightened 1, or frightened 2 if the attack was a critical hit. This is an emotion, fear, and mental effect.", "Gallop", "The skeletal mount Strides twice, with a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed." to Organized Output.
[22:23:16]: Adding ['Skeletal Servant', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=44&Undead=true', 'Your companion is a humanoid skeleton, mindless but capable of assisting in rudimentary chores. Like the skeletal mount, it can be collapsed for easy storage.', 'Small or Medium', [['jaws,', 'Melee', '1d8', 'piercing'], ['claw (agile),', 'Melee', '1d6', 'slashing']], '+2,  +2,  +1,  -5,  +0,  +1', '4', [' none (mindless)'], 'darkvision,', '20 feet', "Your skeletal servant jabs bones into your enemies to distract them while you attack. Until the start of your next turn, when a Strike you make hits and deals damage to a creature within your skeletal servant's reach, that target becomes flat-footed until the end of your next turn.", 'Screaming Skull', "The skeleton removes its skull and throws it, making a jaws Strike with a range of 20 feet. Regardless of whether it hits, the target and all enemies within 10 feet must attempt a Will save or be frightened 1, or frightened 2 on a critical failure. This uses a trained DC using the skeleton's Charisma modifier or an expert DC if the skeleton is specialized. At the start of the skeleton's next turn, the head bounces, rolls, or flies back to reattach. The skeleton is blind while its head is away."] to Organized Output String.
[22:23:16]: Added "Skeletal Servant", "https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=44&Undead=true", "Your companion is a humanoid skeleton, mindless but capable of assisting in rudimentary chores. Until the start of your next turn, when a Strike you make hits and deals damage to a creature within your skeletal servant's reach, that target becomes flat-footed until the end of your next turn.", "Screaming Skull", "The skeleton removes its skull and throws it, making a jaws Strike with a range of 20 feet. Regardless of whether it hits, the target and all enemies within 10 feet must attempt a Will save or be frightened 1, or frightened 2 on a critical failure. This uses a trained DC using the skeleton's Charisma modifier or an expert DC if the skeleton is specialized. At the start of the skeleton's next turn, the head bounces, rolls, or flies back to reattach. The skeleton is blind while its head is away." to Organized Output.

If your hand is nimble or savage, the bludgeoning damage increases to 2d6.", 'Grip Throat', 'The hand attempts to Grapple a Medium or smaller creature by the throat. If the Grapple succeeds, in addition to the normal effects, the creature has difficulty speaking. While it remains grabbed or restrained by the hand, it must spend an extra action to perform any action that has the verbal trait.'] to Organized Output String.

[22:23:16]: Adding ['Zombie Mount', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=52&Undead=true', 'Your companion is the rotting, reanimated corpse of a horse, camel, or similar riding animal.', 'Large', [['hoof,', 'Melee', '1d8', 'bludgeoning']], '+2,  +1,  +3,  -5,  +0,  +0', '8', [' none (mindless)'], 'darkvision,', '30 feet', "Your zombie mount chews on your enemies. Until the start of your next turn, each time you Strike while riding the zombie mount and hit a creature in the zombie mount's reach, the creature takes 1d4 bludgeoning damage from the zombie mount. If your zombie mount is nimble or savage, the bludgeoning damage increases to 2d4. This benefit is based on a zombie horse or camel, but might deal piercing damage if your mount has sharp teeth.", 'Disgusting Gallop', "The zombie mount Strides twice, spraying putrid spittle as it runs. Once during this movement, choose a creature adjacent to the zombie mount. The spittle splashes on it, and the creature must succeed at a Fortitude save or be sickened 1. The creature is then temporarily immune to the spittle for 24 hours. This uses a trained DC using the zombie mount's Constitution modifier, or an expert DC if the mount is specialized."] to Organized Output String.
[22:23:16]: Added "Zombie Mount", "https://2e.aonprd.com/AnimalCompanions.aspx?ID=52&Undead=true", "Your companion is the rotting, reanimated corpse of a horse, camel, or similar riding animal.", "Large", "hoof", "Melee", "1d8", "bludgeoning", "+2","+1","+3", "-5","+0","+0", 8, " none (mindless)", "darkvision,", "30 feet", "Your zombie mount chews on your enemies. Until the start of your next turn, each time you Strike while riding the zombie mount and hit a creature in the zombie mount's reach, the creature takes 1d4 bludgeoning damage from the zombie mount. If your zombie mount is nimble or savage, the bludgeoning damage increases to 2d4. This benefit is based on a zombie horse or camel, but might deal piercing damage if your mount has sharp teeth.", "Disgusting Gallop", "The zombie mount Strides twice, spraying putrid spittle as it runs. Once during this movement, choose a creature adjacent to the zombie mount. The spittle splashes on it, and the creature must succeed at a Fortitude save or be sickened 1. The creature is then temporarily immune to the spittle for 24 hours. This uses a trained DC using the zombie mount's Constitution modifier, or an expert DC if the mount is specialized." to Organized Output.

[22:23:18]: Going to Page: https://2e.aonprd.com/Rules.aspx?ID=1600.
[22:23:21]: Getting Page Source.
[22:23:21]: Setting up BeautifulSoup with Source.
[22:23:21]: Finding Detail Container.
[22:23:21]: Getting All Construct Category Headings.
[22:23:21]: Ignoring Construct Companions.
[22:23:21]: Ignoring Riding Construct Companions.
[22:23:21]: Category Name is Prototype.
[22:23:21]: Formatting Description to Search Through.
[22:23:21]: Removing "h2" Tags From "The following are the base statistics for a prototype construct companion, the first construct companion most characters get. A companion has the same level you do. As you gain levels, you might make further adjustments as your companion grows more powerful. Construct companions calculate their modifiers and DCs just as you do, with one difference: the only item bonuses they can benefit from are to Speed.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1603">Construct Trait</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>A construct companion has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=35" style="text-decoration:underline">construct</a> trait. It's not a living creature, nor is it <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=160" style="text-decoration:underline">undead</a>.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1604">Proficiencies</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion is trained in its unarmed attacks, unarmored defense, all saving throws, Perception, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1" style="text-decoration:underline">Acrobatics</a>, and <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3" style="text-decoration:underline">Athletics</a>. Construct companions can't use abilities that require greater Intelligence, such as <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=52" style="text-decoration:underline">Coerce</a> or <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=22" style="text-decoration:underline">Decipher Writing</a>, even if trained in the appropriate skill, unless they have an ability that allows it.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1605">Size</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion is either Small or Medium, chosen by you when you first gain the companion.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1606">Strikes</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has two kinds of melee <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=199" style="text-decoration:underline">unarmed</a> attacks. Its first unarmed attack deals 1d8 bludgeoning damage. Depending on the shape of your construct this could be a fist, tendril, or other similar unarmed attack. Its other unarmed attack deals 1d6 slashing or piercing damage (choose when you first gain the companion) and has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170" style="text-decoration:underline">agile</a> and <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179" style="text-decoration:underline">finesse</a> traits. Depending on the shape of your construct, this could be a spine or spike, jaws or fangs, a retractable blade, or other similar unarmed attack.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1607">Ability Modifiers</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>A construct companion begins with base ability modifiers of Str +3, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1608">Hit Points</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has 10 Hit Points, plus a number of Hit Points equal to 6 plus its Constitution modifier for each level you have.<br/><br/> While constructs are usually immediately destroyed at 0 Hit Points, your construct companion is a little harder to destroy than other constructs are. When your construct reaches 0 Hit Points, it becomes <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=2" style="text-decoration:underline">broken</a> and begins sparking and might be destroyed if you don't <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> it. This works the same as the normal <a href="Rules.aspx?ID=372" style="text-decoration:underline">dying rules</a> and determines if your construct is destroyed, with the following two changes. First, most effects that end the dying condition don't work to save a construct companion, but a construct can be stabilized using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=54" style="text-decoration:underline">Administer First Aid</a> action, using the <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4" style="text-decoration:underline">Crafting</a> skill instead of <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">Medicine</a>. Second, instead of gaining and tracking the <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">wounded</a> condition, if your construct becomes broken in this way more than twice within a 10-minute period, it's destroyed, and you'll need to reconstruct it by spending a day of downtime.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1609">Immunities</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Because it's a construct, your construct companion is immune to bleed, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=40" style="text-decoration:underline">death</a> effects, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46" style="text-decoration:underline">disease</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">doomed</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=10" style="text-decoration:underline">drained</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=15" style="text-decoration:underline">fatigued</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=89" style="text-decoration:underline">healing</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117" style="text-decoration:underline">necromancy</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188" style="text-decoration:underline">nonlethal</a> attacks, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=28" style="text-decoration:underline">paralyzed</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=126" style="text-decoration:underline">poison</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34" style="text-decoration:underline">sickened</a>, and <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=38" style="text-decoration:underline">unconscious</a>. Because the construct isn't a living creature, effects that heal living creatures can't help it recover Hit Points. Restoring Hit Points to it requires using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> action or other means that can restore Hit Points to objects and nonliving creatures.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1610">Senses</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has precise vision, imprecise hearing, and vague touch senses, but no sense of smell or taste.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1611">Speed</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has a Speed of 25 feet.<br/>".
[22:23:21]: Start: 413.
[22:23:21]: End: 484.
[22:23:21]: Removing "h2" Tags From "The following are the base statistics for a prototype construct companion, the first construct companion most characters get. A companion has the same level you do. As you gain levels, you might make further adjustments as your companion grows more powerful. Construct companions calculate their modifiers and DCs just as you do, with one difference: the only item bonuses they can benefit from are to Speed.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>A construct companion has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=35" style="text-decoration:underline">construct</a> trait. It's not a living creature, nor is it <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=160" style="text-decoration:underline">undead</a>.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1604">Proficiencies</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion is trained in its unarmed attacks, unarmored defense, all saving throws, Perception, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1" style="text-decoration:underline">Acrobatics</a>, and <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3" style="text-decoration:underline">Athletics</a>. Construct companions can't use abilities that require greater Intelligence, such as <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=52" style="text-decoration:underline">Coerce</a> or <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=22" style="text-decoration:underline">Decipher Writing</a>, even if trained in the appropriate skill, unless they have an ability that allows it.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1605">Size</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion is either Small or Medium, chosen by you when you first gain the companion.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1606">Strikes</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has two kinds of melee <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=199" style="text-decoration:underline">unarmed</a> attacks. Its first unarmed attack deals 1d8 bludgeoning damage. Depending on the shape of your construct this could be a fist, tendril, or other similar unarmed attack. Its other unarmed attack deals 1d6 slashing or piercing damage (choose when you first gain the companion) and has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170" style="text-decoration:underline">agile</a> and <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179" style="text-decoration:underline">finesse</a> traits. Depending on the shape of your construct, this could be a spine or spike, jaws or fangs, a retractable blade, or other similar unarmed attack.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1607">Ability Modifiers</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>A construct companion begins with base ability modifiers of Str +3, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1608">Hit Points</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has 10 Hit Points, plus a number of Hit Points equal to 6 plus its Constitution modifier for each level you have.<br/><br/> While constructs are usually immediately destroyed at 0 Hit Points, your construct companion is a little harder to destroy than other constructs are. When your construct reaches 0 Hit Points, it becomes <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=2" style="text-decoration:underline">broken</a> and begins sparking and might be destroyed if you don't <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> it. This works the same as the normal <a href="Rules.aspx?ID=372" style="text-decoration:underline">dying rules</a> and determines if your construct is destroyed, with the following two changes. First, most effects that end the dying condition don't work to save a construct companion, but a construct can be stabilized using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=54" style="text-decoration:underline">Administer First Aid</a> action, using the <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4" style="text-decoration:underline">Crafting</a> skill instead of <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">Medicine</a>. Second, instead of gaining and tracking the <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">wounded</a> condition, if your construct becomes broken in this way more than twice within a 10-minute period, it's destroyed, and you'll need to reconstruct it by spending a day of downtime.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1609">Immunities</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Because it's a construct, your construct companion is immune to bleed, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=40" style="text-decoration:underline">death</a> effects, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46" style="text-decoration:underline">disease</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">doomed</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=10" style="text-decoration:underline">drained</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=15" style="text-decoration:underline">fatigued</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=89" style="text-decoration:underline">healing</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117" style="text-decoration:underline">necromancy</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188" style="text-decoration:underline">nonlethal</a> attacks, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=28" style="text-decoration:underline">paralyzed</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=126" style="text-decoration:underline">poison</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34" style="text-decoration:underline">sickened</a>, and <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=38" style="text-decoration:underline">unconscious</a>. Because the construct isn't a living creature, effects that heal living creatures can't help it recover Hit Points. Restoring Hit Points to it requires using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> action or other means that can restore Hit Points to objects and nonliving creatures.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1610">Senses</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has precise vision, imprecise hearing, and vague touch senses, but no sense of smell or taste.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1611">Speed</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has a Speed of 25 feet.<br/>".

[22:23:21]: Removing "h2" Tags From "The following are the base statistics for a prototype construct companion, the first construct companion most characters get. A companion has the same level you do. As you gain levels, you might make further adjustments as your companion grows more powerful. Construct companions calculate their modifiers and DCs just as you do, with one difference: the only item bonuses they can benefit from are to Speed.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>A construct companion has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=35" style="text-decoration:underline">construct</a> trait. [22:23:21]: Removing "h2" Tags From "The following are the base statistics for a prototype construct companion, the first construct companion most characters get. A companion has the same level you do. As you gain levels, you might make further adjustments as your companion grows more powerful. Construct companions calculate their modifiers and DCs just as you do, with one difference: the only item bonuses they can benefit from are to Speed.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>A construct companion has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=35" style="text-decoration:underline">construct</a> trait. Its first unarmed attack deals 1d8 bludgeoning damage. Depending on the shape of your construct this could be a fist, tendril, or other similar unarmed attack. Its other unarmed attack deals 1d6 slashing or piercing damage (choose when you first gain the companion) and has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170" style="text-decoration:underline">agile</a> and <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179" style="text-decoration:underline">finesse</a> traits. Depending on the shape of your construct, this could be a spine or spike, jaws or fangs, a retractable blade, or other similar unarmed attack.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1607">Ability Modifiers</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>A construct companion begins with base ability modifiers of Str +3, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1608">Hit Points</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has 10 Hit Points, plus a number of Hit Points equal to 6 plus its Constitution modifier for each level you have.<br/><br/> While constructs are usually immediately destroyed at 0 Hit Points, your construct companion is a little harder to destroy than other constructs are. When your construct reaches 0 Hit Points, it becomes <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=2" style="text-decoration:underline">broken</a> and begins sparking and might be destroyed if you don't <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> it. This works the same as the normal <a href="Rules.aspx?ID=372" style="text-decoration:underline">dying rules</a> and determines if your construct is destroyed, with the following two changes. First, most effects that end the dying condition don't work to save a construct companion, but a construct can be stabilized using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=54" style="text-decoration:underline">Administer First Aid</a> action, using the <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4" style="text-decoration:underline">Crafting</a> skill instead of <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">Medicine</a>. Second, instead of gaining and tracking the <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">wounded</a> condition, if your construct becomes broken in this way more than twice within a 10-minute period, it's destroyed, and you'll need to reconstruct it by spending a day of downtime.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1609">Immunities</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Because it's a construct, your construct companion is immune to bleed, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=40" style="text-decoration:underline">death</a> effects, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46" style="text-decoration:underline">disease</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">doomed</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=10" style="text-decoration:underline">drained</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=15" style="text-decoration:underline">fatigued</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=89" style="text-decoration:underline">healing</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117" style="text-decoration:underline">necromancy</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188" style="text-decoration:underline">nonlethal</a> attacks, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=28" style="text-decoration:underline">paralyzed</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=126" style="text-decoration:underline">poison</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34" style="text-decoration:underline">sickened</a>, and <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=38" style="text-decoration:underline">unconscious</a>. Because the construct isn't a living creature, effects that heal living creatures can't help it recover Hit Points. Restoring Hit Points to it requires using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> action or other means that can restore Hit Points to objects and nonliving creatures.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1610">Senses</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has precise vision, imprecise hearing, and vague touch senses, but no sense of smell or taste.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1611">Speed</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has a Speed of 25 feet.<br/>".
[22:23:21]: Start: 2616.
[22:23:21]: End: 2689.
[22:23:21]: Removing "h2" Tags From "The following are the base statistics for a prototype construct companion, the first construct companion most characters get. A companion has the same level you do. As you gain levels, you might make further adjustments as your companion grows more powerful. Construct companions calculate their modifiers and DCs just as you do, with one difference: the only item bonuses they can benefit from are to Speed.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>A construct companion has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=35" style="text-decoration:underline">construct</a> trait. It's not a living creature, nor is it <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=160" style="text-decoration:underline">undead</a>.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion is trained in its unarmed attacks, unarmored defense, all saving throws, Perception, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1" style="text-decoration:underline">Acrobatics</a>, and <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3" style="text-decoration:underline">Athletics</a>. Construct companions can't use abilities that require greater Intelligence, such as <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=52" style="text-decoration:underline">Coerce</a> or <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=22" style="text-decoration:underline">Decipher Writing</a>, even if trained in the appropriate skill, unless they have an ability that allows it.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion is either Small or Medium, chosen by you when you first gain the companion.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has two kinds of melee <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=199" style="text-decoration:underline">unarmed</a> attacks. Its first unarmed attack deals 1d8 bludgeoning damage. Depending on the shape of your construct this could be a fist, tendril, or other similar unarmed attack. Its other unarmed attack deals 1d6 slashing or piercing damage (choose when you first gain the companion) and has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170" style="text-decoration:underline">agile</a> and <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179" style="text-decoration:underline">finesse</a> traits. Depending on the shape of your construct, this could be a spine or spike, jaws or fangs, a retractable blade, or other similar unarmed attack.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>A construct companion begins with base ability modifiers of Str +3, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1608">Hit Points</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has 10 Hit Points, plus a number of Hit Points equal to 6 plus its Constitution modifier for each level you have.<br/><br/> While constructs are usually immediately destroyed at 0 Hit Points, your construct companion is a little harder to destroy than other constructs are. When your construct reaches 0 Hit Points, it becomes <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=2" style="text-decoration:underline">broken</a> and begins sparking and might be destroyed if you don't <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> it. This works the same as the normal <a href="Rules.aspx?ID=372" style="text-decoration:underline">dying rules</a> and determines if your construct is destroyed, with the following two changes. First, most effects that end the dying condition don't work to save a construct companion, but a construct can be stabilized using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=54" style="text-decoration:underline">Administer First Aid</a> action, using the <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4" style="text-decoration:underline">Crafting</a> skill instead of <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">Medicine</a>. Second, instead of gaining and tracking the <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">wounded</a> condition, if your construct becomes broken in this way more than twice within a 10-minute period, it's destroyed, and you'll need to reconstruct it by spending a day of downtime.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1609">Immunities</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Because it's a construct, your construct companion is immune to bleed, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=40" style="text-decoration:underline">death</a> effects, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46" style="text-decoration:underline">disease</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">doomed</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=10" style="text-decoration:underline">drained</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=15" style="text-decoration:underline">fatigued</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=89" style="text-decoration:underline">healing</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117" style="text-decoration:underline">necromancy</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188" style="text-decoration:underline">nonlethal</a> attacks, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=28" style="text-decoration:underline">paralyzed</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=126" style="text-decoration:underline">poison</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34" style="text-decoration:underline">sickened</a>, and <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=38" style="text-decoration:underline">unconscious</a>. Because the construct isn't a living creature, effects that heal living creatures can't help it recover Hit Points. Restoring Hit Points to it requires using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> action or other means that can restore Hit Points to objects and nonliving creatures.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1610">Senses</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has precise vision, imprecise hearing, and vague touch senses, but no sense of smell or taste.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1611">Speed</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has a Speed of 25 feet.<br/>".

Construct companions can't use abilities that require greater Intelligence, such as <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=52" style="text-decoration:underline">Coerce</a> or <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=22" style="text-decoration:underline">Decipher Writing</a>, even if trained in the appropriate skill, unless they have an ability that allows it.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion is either Small or Medium, chosen by you when you first gain the companion.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has two kinds of melee <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=199" style="text-decoration:underline">unarmed</a> attacks. Its first unarmed attack deals 1d8 bludgeoning damage. Depending on the shape of your construct this could be a fist, tendril, or other similar unarmed attack. Its other unarmed attack deals 1d6 slashing or piercing damage (choose when you first gain the companion) and has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170" style="text-decoration:underline">agile</a> and <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179" style="text-decoration:underline">finesse</a> traits. Depending on the shape of your construct, this could be a spine or spike, jaws or fangs, a retractable blade, or other similar unarmed attack.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>A construct companion begins with base ability modifiers of Str +3, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has 10 Hit Points, plus a number of Hit Points equal to 6 plus its Constitution modifier for each level you have.<br/><br/> While constructs are usually immediately destroyed at 0 Hit Points, your construct companion is a little harder to destroy than other constructs are. When your construct reaches 0 Hit Points, it becomes <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=2" style="text-decoration:underline">broken</a> and begins sparking and might be destroyed if you don't <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> it. This works the same as the normal <a href="Rules.aspx?ID=372" style="text-decoration:underline">dying rules</a> and determines if your construct is destroyed, with the following two changes. First, most effects that end the dying condition don't work to save a construct companion, but a construct can be stabilized using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=54" style="text-decoration:underline">Administer First Aid</a> action, using the <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4" style="text-decoration:underline">Crafting</a> skill instead of <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">Medicine</a>. Second, instead of gaining and tracking the <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">wounded</a> condition, if your construct becomes broken in this way more than twice within a 10-minute period, it's destroyed, and you'll need to reconstruct it by spending a day of downtime.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Because it's a construct, your construct companion is immune to bleed, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=40" style="text-decoration:underline">death</a> effects, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46" style="text-decoration:underline">disease</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">doomed</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=10" style="text-decoration:underline">drained</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=15" style="text-decoration:underline">fatigued</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=89" style="text-decoration:underline">healing</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117" style="text-decoration:underline">necromancy</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188" style="text-decoration:underline">nonlethal</a> attacks, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=28" style="text-decoration:underline">paralyzed</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=126" style="text-decoration:underline">poison</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34" style="text-decoration:underline">sickened</a>, and <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=38" style="text-decoration:underline">unconscious</a>. Because the construct isn't a living creature, effects that heal living creatures can't help it recover Hit Points. Restoring Hit Points to it requires using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> action or other means that can restore Hit Points to objects and nonliving creatures.<br/><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has precise vision, imprecise hearing, and vague touch senses, but no sense of smell or taste.<br/><h2 class="title"><a href="Rules.aspx?ID=1611">Speed</a></h2><b>Source</b> <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a><br/>Your construct companion has a Speed of 25 feet.<br/>".
[22:23:21]: Start: 6218.
[22:23:21]: End: 6279.
[22:23:21]: Removing "a" Tags From "The following are the base statistics for a prototype construct companion, the first construct companion most characters get. A companion has the same level you do. As you gain levels, you might make further adjustments as your companion grows more powerful. Construct companions calculate their modifiers and DCs just as you do, with one difference: the only item bonuses they can benefit from are to Speed. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a>A construct companion has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=35" style="text-decoration:underline">construct</a> trait. It's not a living creature, nor is it <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=160" style="text-decoration:underline">undead</a>. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a>Your construct companion is trained in its unarmed attacks, unarmored defense, all saving throws, Perception, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1" style="text-decoration:underline">Acrobatics</a>, and <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3" style="text-decoration:underline">Athletics</a>. Construct companions can't use abilities that require greater Intelligence, such as <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=52" style="text-decoration:underline">Coerce</a> or <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=22" style="text-decoration:underline">Decipher Writing</a>, even if trained in the appropriate skill, unless they have an ability that allows it. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a>Your construct companion is either Small or Medium, chosen by you when you first gain the companion. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a>Your construct companion has two kinds of melee <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=199" style="text-decoration:underline">unarmed</a> attacks. Its first unarmed attack deals 1d8 bludgeoning damage. Depending on the shape of your construct this could be a fist, tendril, or other similar unarmed attack. Its other unarmed attack deals 1d6 slashing or piercing damage (choose when you first gain the companion) and has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170" style="text-decoration:underline">agile</a> and <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179" style="text-decoration:underline">finesse</a> traits. Depending on the shape of your construct, this could be a spine or spike, jaws or fangs, a retractable blade, or other similar unarmed attack. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a>A construct companion begins with base ability modifiers of Str +3, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a>Your construct companion has 10 Hit Points, plus a number of Hit Points equal to 6 plus its Constitution modifier for each level you have. While constructs are usually immediately destroyed at 0 Hit Points, your construct companion is a little harder to destroy than other constructs are. When your construct reaches 0 Hit Points, it becomes <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=2" style="text-decoration:underline">broken</a> and begins sparking and might be destroyed if you don't <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> it. This works the same as the normal <a href="Rules.aspx?ID=372" style="text-decoration:underline">dying rules</a> and determines if your construct is destroyed, with the following two changes. First, most effects that end the dying condition don't work to save a construct companion, but a construct can be stabilized using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=54" style="text-decoration:underline">Administer First Aid</a> action, using the <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4" style="text-decoration:underline">Crafting</a> skill instead of <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">Medicine</a>. Second, instead of gaining and tracking the <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">wounded</a> condition, if your construct becomes broken in this way more than twice within a 10-minute period, it's destroyed, and you'll need to reconstruct it by spending a day of downtime. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a>Because it's a construct, your construct companion is immune to bleed, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=40" style="text-decoration:underline">death</a> effects, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46" style="text-decoration:underline">disease</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">doomed</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=10" style="text-decoration:underline">drained</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=15" style="text-decoration:underline">fatigued</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=89" style="text-decoration:underline">healing</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117" style="text-decoration:underline">necromancy</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188" style="text-decoration:underline">nonlethal</a> attacks, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=28" style="text-decoration:underline">paralyzed</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=126" style="text-decoration:underline">poison</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34" style="text-decoration:underline">sickened</a>, and <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=38" style="text-decoration:underline">unconscious</a>. Because the construct isn't a living creature, effects that heal living creatures can't help it recover Hit Points. Restoring Hit Points to it requires using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> action or other means that can restore Hit Points to objects and nonliving creatures. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a>Your construct companion has precise vision, imprecise hearing, and vague touch senses, but no sense of smell or taste. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a>Your construct companion has a Speed of 25 feet.".
[22:23:21]: Start: 409.
[22:23:21]: Removing "a" Tags From "The following are the base statistics for a prototype construct companion, the first construct companion most characters get. A companion has the same level you do. As you gain levels, you might make further adjustments as your companion grows more powerful. Construct companions calculate their modifiers and DCs just as you do, with one difference: the only item bonuses they can benefit from are to Speed. <i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i>A construct companion has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=35" style="text-decoration:underline">construct</a> trait. It's not a living creature, nor is it <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=160" style="text-decoration:underline">undead</a>. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a>Your construct companion is trained in its unarmed attacks, unarmored defense, all saving throws, Perception, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1" style="text-decoration:underline">Acrobatics</a>, and <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3" style="text-decoration:underline">Athletics</a>. Construct companions can't use abilities that require greater Intelligence, such as <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=52" style="text-decoration:underline">Coerce</a> or <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=22" style="text-decoration:underline">Decipher Writing</a>, even if trained in the appropriate skill, unless they have an ability that allows it. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a>Your construct companion is either Small or Medium, chosen by you when you first gain the companion. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a>Your construct companion has two kinds of melee <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=199" style="text-decoration:underline">unarmed</a> attacks. Its first unarmed attack deals 1d8 bludgeoning damage. Depending on the shape of your construct this could be a fist, tendril, or other similar unarmed attack. Its other unarmed attack deals 1d6 slashing or piercing damage (choose when you first gain the companion) and has the <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170" style="text-decoration:underline">agile</a> and <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179" style="text-decoration:underline">finesse</a> traits. Depending on the shape of your construct, this could be a spine or spike, jaws or fangs, a retractable blade, or other similar unarmed attack. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a>A construct companion begins with base ability modifiers of Str +3, Dex +3, Con +2, Int –4, Wis +1, Cha +0. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 32</i></a>Your construct companion has 10 Hit Points, plus a number of Hit Points equal to 6 plus its Constitution modifier for each level you have. While constructs are usually immediately destroyed at 0 Hit Points, your construct companion is a little harder to destroy than other constructs are. When your construct reaches 0 Hit Points, it becomes <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=2" style="text-decoration:underline">broken</a> and begins sparking and might be destroyed if you don't <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> it. This works the same as the normal <a href="Rules.aspx?ID=372" style="text-decoration:underline">dying rules</a> and determines if your construct is destroyed, with the following two changes. First, most effects that end the dying condition don't work to save a construct companion, but a construct can be stabilized using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=54" style="text-decoration:underline">Administer First Aid</a> action, using the <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4" style="text-decoration:underline">Crafting</a> skill instead of <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">Medicine</a>. Second, instead of gaining and tracking the <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">wounded</a> condition, if your construct becomes broken in this way more than twice within a 10-minute period, it's destroyed, and you'll need to reconstruct it by spending a day of downtime. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a>Because it's a construct, your construct companion is immune to bleed, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=40" style="text-decoration:underline">death</a> effects, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46" style="text-decoration:underline">disease</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9" style="text-decoration:underline">doomed</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=10" style="text-decoration:underline">drained</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=15" style="text-decoration:underline">fatigued</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=89" style="text-decoration:underline">healing</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117" style="text-decoration:underline">necromancy</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188" style="text-decoration:underline">nonlethal</a> attacks, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=28" style="text-decoration:underline">paralyzed</a>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=126" style="text-decoration:underline">poison</a>, <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34" style="text-decoration:underline">sickened</a>, and <a href="Conditions.aspx?ID=38" style="text-decoration:underline">unconscious</a>. Because the construct isn't a living creature, effects that heal living creatures can't help it recover Hit Points. Restoring Hit Points to it requires using the <a href="Actions.aspx?ID=42" style="text-decoration:underline">Repair</a> action or other means that can restore Hit Points to objects and nonliving creatures. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a>Your construct companion has precise vision, imprecise hearing, and vague touch senses, but no sense of smell or taste. <a class="external-link" href="https://paizo.com/products/btq026mw" target="_blank"><i>Guns &amp; Gears pg. 33</i></a>Your construct companion has a Speed of 25 feet.".
